study_point: Class - an idea, blueprint, or recipe for an instance
Instance - an instantiation of the class; very often used interchangeably with the word 'object'
Object - Python's representation of data and methods, objects could be aggregates of instances
Attribute - any object or class trait; could be a variable or method
Method - A function built into a class or object; some say it's a callable atrribute
Type - refers to the class that was used to instantiate the object

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point: xml.etree.ElementTree - has a very simple API for analyzing and creating XML data.

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point: XML - Extensible Markup Language is a markup language intended for storing and transporting data, e.g., by systems using the SOAP communication protocol.

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point:
XML Documents Contain:
- Prolog
- Root Element
- Elements
- Attributes

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point: The getroot method returns the root element.

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point:
The root elements and all its children are Element objects.
tag - this returns the tag name as a string.
attrib - this returns all attributes in the tag as a dictionary.

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point: In addition to iterating over tree elements, we can access them directly using indexes.

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point: The iter method in the Element class returns all elements by having the tag passed as an argument, the iterator iterates recursively through all child elements and their nested elements.

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point: The Element object has a method called findall to search for direct child elements, findall only searches the children of at the first nesting level.

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point: The findall method also accepts an XPath expression.

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point: The find method returns the first child element containing the specified tag or matching XPath expression.

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point: XML is a standard recommended by the W3C organization.

sub_topic: xml - creating and processing XML files
study_point: To create a tree (an ElementTree object) from an existing XML document, pass it to the parse method.  In addition to the parse method, we can use the method called fromstring, which takes an XML string.
